column5: So if you say something to a person that is hard of hearing, and they say EH? Do you then just ignore them?
We just returned from up there yesterday and we had a good time trying to work "ya'll" and "eh" in the same sentence. Lot of fun.
Here in DEtroit we may not know football, but we do know pickerel eh.
A friend of mine (who was intoxicated at the time) once asked a Canadian woman why they always say eh? Her response was, why do Americans always say, huh?

Hey y'all. This has to be one of the funniest posts I've seen in a long time, huh. Know what I'm talkin aboot, eh? Glad to see we can all poke fun at ourselves without getting all uptight. That's dem der fisherman for ya.
Whenever we post on the Canadian board, shouldn't we be finishing all sentences with EH? It's like the law or something up there.
Dud, eh, You already forgot the 'eh', eh. "It's like the law or something up there, eh."
Huh? I don't get it. Huh?

i believe that using "eh?" at the end of every sentence would be incorrect. it is my belief that "eh?" is used as a verbal punctuation mark for the end of a rhetorical question. What's a rhetorical question? any question asked for a purpose other than to obtain the information the question asks. For example on one of my trips to canada my pal jim forgot to buy some milk for his coffee when we drove into the bait/convienence store, so we went back inside and the clerck said "Forgot something, eh?" just a polite greeting. Jim went on to respond "forgot the milk, eh?" apparently trying to live up to the traveler's cliche when in Rome..... the clerk gave jim a rather cold look and dryly said "you don't know that eh? stuff" i guess you had to be there, 'cause i laughed all the way back to camp.
If you'll forgive my "EH" I'll forgive your "YAALLL" W5
Us in ChiCAAGo don't have any accent!!!
Huh? What do we say to our neighbors down south? C senoir? <{{}}><
neider do us up here, eh, in Wesconsen, er no?
Oh no, those in Chicago Land, and thereabouts have the most annoying accent. All that nasal-ey stuff.
